issue.title: optional<const T> doesn't compare with T

discussion.p: The comparison is ill-formed, because in [optional.comp_with_t]/1,
discussion.pre: template <class T> constexpr bool operator==(const optional<T>& x, const T& v);
discussion.p: the T is deduced to be both const int and int, which is ill-formed.
Since it became apparent that the root cause of this issue is also causing difficulties with e.g. comparing optional<string> with literals etc., here's a p/r that

li.p: adds requirements for optional's comparisons with T
turns optional-optional comparisons into two-template-parameter templates, allowing comparing mixed optionals
turns optional-T comparisons into two-template-parameter templates, allowing comparing optionals with T and types comparable with T

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4640.

blockquote.pre: template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator==(const optional<T>& x, const optional<TU>& y);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator!=(const optional<T>& x, const optional<TU>& y);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator<(const optional<T>& x, const optional<TU>& y);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator>(const optional<T>& x, const optional<TU>& y);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator<=(const optional<T>& x, const optional<TU>& y);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator>=(const optional<T>& x, const optional<TU>& y);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator==(const optional<T>& x, const TU& v);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator==(const TU& v, const optional<T>& x);

blockquote.p:
-?- Requires: The expression v == *x shall be well-formed and its result shall be convertible to bool.
-2- Effects: Equivalent to: return bool(x) ? v == *x : false;

blockquote.pre: template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator!=(const optional<T>& x, const TU& v);

blockquote.p:
-?- Requires: The expression *x != v shall be well-formed and its result shall be convertible to bool.
-3- Effects: Equivalent to: return bool(x) ? *x != v : true;

blockquote.pre: template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator!=(const TU& v, const optional<T>& x);

blockquote.p:
-?- Requires: The expression v != *x shall be well-formed and its result shall be convertible to bool.
-4- Effects: Equivalent to: return bool(x) ? v != *x : true;

blockquote.pre: template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator<(const optional<T>& x, const TU& v);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator<(const TU& v, const optional<T>& x);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator<=(const optional<T>& x, const TU& v);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator<=(const TU& v, const optional<T>& x);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator>(const optional<T>& x, const TU& v);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator>(const TU& v, const optional<T>& x);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator>=(const optional<T>& x, const TU& v);
template <class T, class U> constexpr bool operator>=(const TU& v, const optional<T>& x);
